unnormalised: This year, the buzz is all about whether young Rohan Sharma, the midfield maestro from the I-League champions, Minerva Academy, will make the jump to a big ISL club. Word on the street is that Mumbai City FC and ATK Mohun Bagan are battling it out for his signature. Apparently, Mumbai are offering a cool Rs. 2.5 crore signing bonus and a plush apartment in Bandra, while Kolkata are tempting him with the promise of playing in front of their crazy fans at the Salt Lake Stadium. Tough choice, eh? Like choosing between Gulab Jamun and Rasmalai - both are sweet temptations.

unnormalised: And speaking of tempting, remember that story last year about Deepak Verma almost joining a club in Europe? The lad from Faridabad had trials with a second division team in Spain, apparently ran 10.5 seconds in the 100m during testing! Unfortunately, visa issues stalled the deal. Such a 'DDLJ' moment – almost there but… woh kya kehte hain… "bade bade deshon mein aisi chhoti chhoti baatein hoti rehti hain."

unnormalised: Then there's the curious case of veteran defender, Sunil Chhetri (no relation to the legendary Indian captain, I swear!). He's been linked with a move to a coaching role at his former club, East Bengal. Could we see him hang up his boots and transition to management? It's a possibility, but Sunil is a fighter, a true "Mard Ko Dard Nahi Hota" kinda guy, so I wouldn't write him off just yet.
